post.author: 이상윤
post.content:
TASK Meeting Location

September 28th
Last Wednesday of Every Month
6:00 to 9:00

205 Richmond Street West, Suite 702
South-East Corner of Duncan/Richmond  

Just back from Defcon. A great presentation was done by Jame Butler and Sherri Sparks (of rootkit.com).  

Essentially, they explained, then demonstrated memory subversion - a first for rootkits. The proof of concept was built on the FU rootkit. It clearly has a ways to go before we'll see this full featured and stable in the wild, but its a good look at the future.

Read all the details at: http://www.phrack.org/phrack/63/p63-0x08_Raising_The_Bar_For_Windows_Rootkit_Detection.txt
_________________
- Brian Bourne, CISSP, MCSE:Security
post.title: The topic: "Shadow Walker: Raising the Bar for Windows Rootkit Detection"
